sentences.sContent: In “the black cat” the adjective “black”modifies the noun “cat”.
sentences.sContent_eng: In “the black cat” the adjective “black”modifies the noun “cat”.
sentences.sCn: 在“那只黑猫”中，形容词“黑的”修饰名词“猫”。

sentences.sContent: The "me" circuit hummed not only when they thought whether a particular adjective described themselves, but also when they considered whether it described their mother.
sentences.sContent_eng: The "me" circuit hummed not only when they thought whether a particular adjective described themselves, but also when they considered whether it described their mother.
sentences.sCn: “我”神经回路不仅当他们想到一个特定形容词是否描述自我时接通，而且当他们思考该词是否形容自己母亲时也同样。

sentences.sContent: Using phrases like “Darwinian selection” or “Darwinian evolution” implies there must be another kind of evolution at work, a process that can be described with another adjective.
sentences.sContent_eng: Using phrases like “Darwinian selection” or “Darwinian evolution” implies there must be another kind of evolution at work, a process that can be described with another adjective.
sentences.sCn: 使用“达尔文选择”或“达尔文进化论”这样的短语意味着工作中必须有另一种进化形式，一种可以用另一个形容词来描述的过程。

words.tran: 作形容词用地；形容词般地

trans.tranOther: a word that describes a noun or  pronoun  . In the phrase ‘black hat’, ‘black’ is an adjective and in the sentence ‘It makes her happy’, ‘happy’ is an adjective.
